QUESTION: 50 degrees cephalad on the sagittal plane, 10 degrees medial on the axial plane with a start point at at the medial/lateral midpoint 3mm from the most inferior aspect of C2 inferior articular process.
A Lenke 4 adolescent idiopathic scoliotic curve contains
OPTION_A: structural proximal thoracic, main thoracic and thoracolumbar/lumbar curves
OPTION_C: structural main thoracic and thoracolumbar/lumbar curves
OPTION_D: structural proximal thoracic and main thoracic curves

QUESTION: A lumbar modifier of B in the lenke classification of adolescent idiopathic scoliosis suggests
OPTION_A: the central sacral vertical line does not touch the apical lumbar vertebrae
OPTION_B: the central sacral vertical line touches the apical lumbar pedicle
OPTION_C: the central sacral vertical axis passes between the pedicles of the apical lumbar vertebrae.

QUESTION: A normal value of Power's ratio is
A subtotal discectomy is performed and the patient is transported to the PACU safely. Postoperatively they complain of numbness on the right thigh. The most likely cause is
OPTION_C: Stretch of the femoral nerve during positioning

QUESTION: An atlantodens interval of ___ indicates isolated injury to the transverse ligament, without accessory ligament damage.
Ankylosis of the sacroiliac joints
OPTION_B: is the last area of the spine to ankylose in DISH
OPTION_C: should be anticipated in DISH only after the age of 60
OPTION_D: rarely if ever occurs in DISH

QUESTION: As the enters the T12 pedicle on the right side with the pedicle finder, he feels resistance at 30mm with a spongy quality.
OPTION_A: He is likely in the T11-12 disc space and should reorient the pedicle finder caudally
OPTION_B: He is likely in the T12-L1 disc space and should reorient the pedicle finder cranially
OPTION_C: He has breeched laterally into soft tissue and should reorient himself with fluoroscopy
OPTION_D: He has breeched medially into the cord and should rely on fluoroscopy for correction.

QUESTION: At the L3-4 spinal level a far lateral disc herniation will compress which nerve root?
At the L4-5 spinal level, a posterolateral disc will compress which nerve?
